approvalStatus.externalId.description: When you use SuiteFlow for purchase approvals, purchase orders and requests include the Approval Status field. The Approval Status field reflects the state of the transaction in the approval process.Purchase orders and requests may have one of the following statuses:    * Pending Approval – The purchase has not yet been approved.    * Approved – The purchase has been given approval for processing.    * Rejected – The purchase approval is refused and the order will not be processed.You may manually select a different status in this field if needed.
approvalStatus.externalId.name: approvalStatus.externalId

approvalStatus.internalId.description: When you use SuiteFlow for purchase approvals, purchase orders and requests include the Approval Status field. The Approval Status field reflects the state of the transaction in the approval process.Purchase orders and requests may have one of the following statuses:    * Pending Approval – The purchase has not yet been approved.    * Approved – The purchase has been given approval for processing.    * Rejected – The purchase approval is refused and the order will not be processed.You may manually select a different status in this field if needed.
approvalStatus.internalId.name: approvalStatus.internalId

approvalStatus.name.description: When you use SuiteFlow for purchase approvals, purchase orders and requests include the Approval Status field. The Approval Status field reflects the state of the transaction in the approval process.Purchase orders and requests may have one of the following statuses:    * Pending Approval – The purchase has not yet been approved.    * Approved – The purchase has been given approval for processing.    * Rejected – The purchase approval is refused and the order will not be processed.You may manually select a different status in this field if needed.
approvalStatus.name.name: approvalStatus.name

availableVendorCredit.description: If you have customized the purchase order to display the Available Vendor Credit field, changing the subsidiary changes the available credit limit value to reflect the currency of the selected subsidiary.
availableVendorCredit.name: availableVendorCredit

billAddressList.externalId.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record.Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. See AddressbookList.
billAddressList.externalId.name: billAddressList.externalId

billAddressList.internalId.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record.Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. See AddressbookList.
billAddressList.internalId.name: billAddressList.internalId

billAddressList.name.description: Sets the billing address for this transaction. This field defaults to the default Billing Address set on the associated Customer record.Use CustomerAddressBookList on the Customer Record to retrieve a list of currently defined addresses for a specific customer. See AddressbookList.
billAddressList.name.name: billAddressList.name

currency.externalId.description: This field displays the vendor Currency used for this transaction.If you use the Multiple Currencies or Multi-Currency Vendors features, you can select any of this vendor's currencies to use on this transaction.Important: Beginning with Version 2014 Release 2, the capabilities associated with the Multiple Currencies, Multi-Currency Customers, and Multi-Currency Vendors features are combined in the Multiple Currencies feature. If you are new to NetSuite, already using all three features, or not using all three features, only the Multiple Currencies box will appear on the Company subtab of the Enable Features page. When you enable this feature, you gain access to support for multiple currency customers and vendors. If you are already using Multiple Currencies and Multi-Currency Customers or Multi-Currency Vendors but not all three features, you will continue to see and maintain three boxes on the Company subtab.
currency.externalId.name: currency.externalId

currency.internalId.description: This field displays the vendor Currency used for this transaction.If you use the Multiple Currencies or Multi-Currency Vendors features, you can select any of this vendor's currencies to use on this transaction.Important: Beginning with Version 2014 Release 2, the capabilities associated with the Multiple Currencies, Multi-Currency Customers, and Multi-Currency Vendors features are combined in the Multiple Currencies feature. If you are new to NetSuite, already using all three features, or not using all three features, only the Multiple Currencies box will appear on the Company subtab of the Enable Features page. When you enable this feature, you gain access to support for multiple currency customers and vendors. If you are already using Multiple Currencies and Multi-Currency Customers or Multi-Currency Vendors but not all three features, you will continue to see and maintain three boxes on the Company subtab.
currency.internalId.name: currency.internalId

currency.name.description: This field displays the vendor Currency used for this transaction.If you use the Multiple Currencies or Multi-Currency Vendors features, you can select any of this vendor's currencies to use on this transaction.Important: Beginning with Version 2014 Release 2, the capabilities associated with the Multiple Currencies, Multi-Currency Customers, and Multi-Currency Vendors features are combined in the Multiple Currencies feature. If you are new to NetSuite, already using all three features, or not using all three features, only the Multiple Currencies box will appear on the Company subtab of the Enable Features page. When you enable this feature, you gain access to support for multiple currency customers and vendors. If you are already using Multiple Currencies and Multi-Currency Customers or Multi-Currency Vendors but not all three features, you will continue to see and maintain three boxes on the Company subtab.
currency.name.name: currency.name

currencyName.description: This vendor's currency is shown in this field.All currency amounts on this transaction are shown in this currency.
currencyName.name: currencyName

customForm.externalId.description: If you customized a purchase order form, select it here, or click New to customize a new purchase order form.
customForm.externalId.name: customForm.externalId

customForm.internalId.description: If you customized a purchase order form, select it here, or click New to customize a new purchase order form.
customForm.internalId.name: customForm.internalId

customForm.name.description: If you customized a purchase order form, select it here, or click New to customize a new purchase order form.
customForm.name.name: customForm.name

department.externalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when the Make Departments Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level. See PurchaseOrderItemList.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

department.internalId.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when the Make Departments Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level. See PurchaseOrderItemList.
department.internalId.name: department.internalId

department.name.description: References a value from a user defined list at Setup > Company > Departments. This field is required when the Make Departments Mandatory preference is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences. Depending on account configuration, this field may need to be set at the item line level. See PurchaseOrderItemList.
department.name.name: department.name

dueDate.description: Sets the due date for this Purchase Order.
dueDate.name: dueDate

entity.externalId.description: References an existing entity record. Required on Add.
entity.externalId.name: entity.externalId

entity.internalId.description: References an existing entity record. Required on Add.
entity.internalId.name: entity.internalId

entity.name.description: References an existing entity record. Required on Add.
entity.name.name: entity.name

entityTaxRegNum.externalId.displayName: Vendor Tax Reg. Number - External id
entityTaxRegNum.externalId.name: entityTaxRegNum.externalId

entityTaxRegNum.internalId.displayName: Vendor Tax Reg. Number - Internal id
entityTaxRegNum.internalId.name: entityTaxRegNum.internalId

exchangeRate.description: Required on Add but if not provided defaults to the rate associated with the vendor set in the entity field.
exchangeRate.name: exchangeRate

fob.description: Enter the location where you technically acquire ownership. For example, if you own goods as soon as they ship and pay the shipping costs from your vendor s location to your own, you might enter Shipping point.
fob.name: fob

incoterm.externalId.description: Select the standardized term for this transaction.Incoterms are international commercial procurement practices that communicate the tasks, costs, and risks associated with the transportation and delivery of goods.Incoterms define where the customer takes ownership of the product and are typically used for international orders, such as when an item goes through customs or crosses a border.
incoterm.externalId.name: incoterm.externalId

incoterm.internalId.description: Select the standardized term for this transaction.Incoterms are international commercial procurement practices that communicate the tasks, costs, and risks associated with the transportation and delivery of goods.Incoterms define where the customer takes ownership of the product and are typically used for international orders, such as when an item goes through customs or crosses a border.
incoterm.internalId.name: incoterm.internalId

incoterm.name.description: Select the standardized term for this transaction.Incoterms are international commercial procurement practices that communicate the tasks, costs, and risks associated with the transportation and delivery of goods.Incoterms define where the customer takes ownership of the product and are typically used for international orders, such as when an item goes through customs or crosses a border.
incoterm.name.name: incoterm.name

intercoStatus.value.description: Intercompany Transaction Status can be:    * Linked - intercompany order has been paired with an intercompany order in another subsidiary.    * Pending - iintercompany order has not been paired with a corresponding order in another subsidiary.    * Rejected - intercompany purchase order or vendor return authorization cannot be paired with a sales order or return authorization because it contains incorrect information, such as subsidiary, currency, amount, or other detail.
intercoStatus.value.name: intercoStatus.value

intercoTransaction.externalId.description: Identifies the intercompany order in another subsidiary that this order is paired with.Order pairs include Sales Order/Purchase Order and Vendor Return Authorization/Return Authorization.
intercoTransaction.externalId.name: intercoTransaction.externalId

intercoTransaction.internalId.description: Identifies the intercompany order in another subsidiary that this order is paired with.Order pairs include Sales Order/Purchase Order and Vendor Return Authorization/Return Authorization.
intercoTransaction.internalId.name: intercoTransaction.internalId

intercoTransaction.name.description: Identifies the intercompany order in another subsidiary that this order is paired with.Order pairs include Sales Order/Purchase Order and Vendor Return Authorization/Return Authorization.
intercoTransaction.name.name: intercoTransaction.name

location.externalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.externalId.name: location.externalId

location.internalId.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.internalId.name: location.internalId

location.name.description: References a value in a user-defined list at Setup > Company > Classifications > Locations. This field is required when Make Locations Mandatory is enabled at Setup > Accounting > Accounting Preferences.
location.name.name: location.name

memo.description: If you wish, enter a memo to describe this order. It will appear on reports such as the 2-line Purchase Orders register.
memo.name: memo

message.description: Defaults to the value selected in messageSel.
message.name: message

nextApprover.externalId.description: When you use SuiteFlow for purchase approvals, purchase orders and requests include the Next Approver field.The Next Approver field displays the employee who approves or rejects the purchase based on the workflow requirements.You can manually select a different approver in this field if necessary.Note: If you have an approval chain or series of approvers for the same transaction, the value in this field can change during the approval process.
nextApprover.externalId.name: nextApprover.externalId

nextApprover.internalId.description: When you use SuiteFlow for purchase approvals, purchase orders and requests include the Next Approver field.The Next Approver field displays the employee who approves or rejects the purchase based on the workflow requirements.You can manually select a different approver in this field if necessary.Note: If you have an approval chain or series of approvers for the same transaction, the value in this field can change during the approval process.
nextApprover.internalId.name: nextApprover.internalId

nextApprover.name.description: When you use SuiteFlow for purchase approvals, purchase orders and requests include the Next Approver field.The Next Approver field displays the employee who approves or rejects the purchase based on the workflow requirements.You can manually select a different approver in this field if necessary.Note: If you have an approval chain or series of approvers for the same transaction, the value in this field can change during the approval process.
nextApprover.name.name: nextApprover.name

nexus.externalId.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.externalId.name: nexus.externalId

nexus.internalId.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.internalId.name: nexus.internalId

nexus.name.description: This field shows the nexus of the transaction. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different nexus in the dropdown list, the corresponding tax registration number is automatically selected in the Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number field.
nexus.name.name: nexus.name

otherRefNum.description: Sets the customer PO number associated with the current Purchase Order.
otherRefNum.name: otherRefNum

purchaseContract.externalId.description: This field displays the purchase contract associated with this order. For details about purchase contracts, click Help and read Purchase Contracts.
purchaseContract.externalId.name: purchaseContract.externalId

purchaseContract.internalId.description: This field displays the purchase contract associated with this order. For details about purchase contracts, click Help and read Purchase Contracts.
purchaseContract.internalId.name: purchaseContract.internalId

purchaseContract.name.description: This field displays the purchase contract associated with this order. For details about purchase contracts, click Help and read Purchase Contracts.
purchaseContract.name.name: purchaseContract.name

shipAddressList.externalId.description: Select the appropriate shipping address for this transaction. Select New to enter a new shipping address.
shipAddressList.externalId.name: shipAddressList.externalId

shipAddressList.internalId.description: Select the appropriate shipping address for this transaction. Select New to enter a new shipping address.
shipAddressList.internalId.name: shipAddressList.internalId

shipAddressList.name.description: Select the appropriate shipping address for this transaction. Select New to enter a new shipping address.
shipAddressList.name.name: shipAddressList.name

shipDate.description: Enter the date you expect the items to be shipped.
shipDate.name: shipDate

shipMethod.externalId.description: Select your shipping method for this transaction.
shipMethod.externalId.name: shipMethod.externalId

shipMethod.internalId.description: Select your shipping method for this transaction.
shipMethod.internalId.name: shipMethod.internalId

shipMethod.name.description: Select your shipping method for this transaction.
shipMethod.name.name: shipMethod.name

shipTo.externalId.description: Select the customer you are shipping this order to. Select New to enter a new shipping address.
shipTo.externalId.name: shipTo.externalId

shipTo.internalId.description: Select the customer you are shipping this order to. Select New to enter a new shipping address.
shipTo.internalId.name: shipTo.internalId

shipTo.name.description: Select the customer you are shipping this order to. Select New to enter a new shipping address.
shipTo.name.name: shipTo.name

subsidiary.externalId.description: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.externalId.name: subsidiary.externalId

subsidiary.internalId.description: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.internalId.name: subsidiary.internalId

subsidiary.name.description: This field displays the subsidiary associated with this transaction.
subsidiary.name.name: subsidiary.name

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.displayName: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number - External id
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.externalId

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.displayName: Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number - Internal id
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.internalId

subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name.description: This field shows the tax registration number of the transaction nexus. NetSuite automatically populates this field based on the nexus lookup logic. You can override the transaction nexus and tax registration number that NetSuite automatically selects by checking the Nexus Override box. When you select a different tax registration number in the dropdown list, the corresponding nexus is automatically selected in the Nexus field.
subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name.name: subsidiaryTaxRegNum.name

supervisorApproval.description: Can only be set for roles that have approval permissions.
supervisorApproval.name: supervisorApproval

tax2Total.description: NetSuite multiplies the tax rate by the taxable total of line items and enters it here.
tax2Total.name: tax2Total

taxDetailsOverride.description: Check this box to override the tax information on the Tax Details subtab of the transaction. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the tax details.
taxDetailsOverride.name: taxDetailsOverride

taxRegOverride.description: Check this box to override the values in the Nexus and Subsidiary Tax Reg. Number fields. Only roles with at least the Edit level of the Tax Details Tab permission can override the values that NetSuite automatically selects in these fields.
taxRegOverride.name: taxRegOverride

taxTotal.description: NetSuite multiplies the tax rate by the taxable total of line items and enters it here.
taxTotal.name: taxTotal

terms.externalId.description: Select the discount terms that will apply to this order.To add additional choices to this list, go to Setup > Accounting > Accounting Lists > New > Terms.
terms.externalId.name: terms.externalId

terms.internalId.description: Select the discount terms that will apply to this order.To add additional choices to this list, go to Setup > Accounting > Accounting Lists > New > Terms.
terms.internalId.name: terms.internalId

terms.name.description: Select the discount terms that will apply to this order.To add additional choices to this list, go to Setup > Accounting > Accounting Lists > New > Terms.
terms.name.name: terms.name

toBeEmailed.description: Causes the invoice to be mailed to all email addresses included in the email field.
toBeEmailed.name: toBeEmailed

toBeFaxed.description: Causes the invoice to be faxed to the fax number included in the fax field.
toBeFaxed.name: toBeFaxed

toBePrinted.description: If enabled, this invoice is saved in a queue of invoices that can be printed at a later date.
toBePrinted.name: toBePrinted

total.description: This is a read-only field that returns the total of line items, tax and shipping costs.
total.name: total

trackingNumbers.description: Enter the shipment tracking number from the shipping company.If a tracking number is entered in the exact format used by UPS or FedEx and the transaction is saved, the tracking number will show on the transaction as a link to the UPS or FedEx website. You can click the link to check the status of the shipment.
trackingNumbers.name: trackingNumbers

tranDate.description: Required on Add but if not provided, defaults to the current date.
tranDate.name: tranDate

tranId.description: NetSuite increases the largest purchase order number by one. If you wish, you can type another number. The next PO number will revert to the standard pattern.Note: The maximum number of characters you can enter in this field is 45.
tranId.name: tranId

type.value.description: Select the customer you are shipping this order to. Select New to enter a new shipping address.
type.value.name: type.value
